well I'll be damned... : ) looks like the day is saved after all, folks!

awright, it's been a lond day... for the sake of new arrivals, let's summarize everything we know thus far. : )
instructions in short: after installing the game, INSTEAD OF installing the dlc's as well right away, you need to start the game and set both online options off in the settings menu. once finished, exit, install the dlc's, then download the crack from http://narod.ru/disk/17292172000/giveme2entitlements.zip.html (major credits go to rest_ip for providing us with the link), extract the exe and simply run the thing. it overwrites one of the game's encrypted ini files, that most possibly contains the dreaded flags. : ) after this, the activation screen at the beginning of the game shouldn't appear anymore.
important note: the DLC that grants you the new recruitable characted Zaeed isn't yet included in the torrent (probably because it came out somewhat later than the dlc's listed above). as last I checked, you could download the Zaeed DLC from this link (file size is about 500 MB): http://static.cdn.ea.com/bioware/u/f/eagames/bioware/masseffect2/DLC/ME2_Zaeed.exe
BTW, does somebody know, how we could get our hands on the Hammerhead DLC? : ) as far as I know, it should be out already. if anyone discovers a link to it, be sure to let us know! : )
now get to it, ladies, the galaxy ain't gonna save itself!

important note! for those who still have some issues preventing the activation screen from appearing - try this: after installing the fresh copy of the game, what you should immediately do BEFORE starting the game for the first time, is to check out the exceptions menu of your firewall settings, and make sure that the checkboxes next to 'Mass Effect 2 Game' and 'Mass Effect 2 Game Launcher' aren't ticked in. in my case, the game puts itself amond the firewall exceptions by default after having been installed. as far as I understand, if you prevent the game from accessing the net, you should be able to get the dlc's to work without any problems.
last but not least: loads of thanks and appreciation for all the people who helped us in obtaining the dlc packs, not to mention the genius minds behind the invaluable entitlement crack. : ) your heroic dedication shall be remembered for generations to come. : )

when you ran the crack executable, did a dialogue window actually pop up, asking you whether or not to replace the ini file? OR did the exe simply finish running without the popup window?
a dialogue window did pop up and i replaced the file

if you haven't tried it already, perhaps you should try - aside the firewall blocking method - to block your internet access by actually disabling your internet connection in Start Menu -> Settings ->... etc. for the duration of the installation/settings/cracking (although when you execute the giveme2enlistments.exe, it may require an active internet connection at that precise moment to properly function without crashing). other than that, I really don't know what else to suggest... : S
